body:
Our department leader hopes to be able to use the hot deployment method very much, so that we can quickly promote this system to the merchants. So is there any way to achieve hot deployment? Such as  modify source code from "premain" to "agentmain"?  Or modify startup mode?  Or modify the configuration file? 
Can you provide relevant documents of hot deployment?

> No, we are not using that. If you have interests, read the document about the differences. We need to change class structure, so agentmain is not the option.

---------------------------------------------------My question ------------------------------------------------
Our department leader hopes to be able to use the hot deployment method very much, so that we can quickly promote this system to the merchants. 
Question1: 
         So is there any way to achieve hot deployment? Such as  modify source code from "premain" to "agentmain"?  Or modify startup mode?  Or modify the configuration file? 
Can you provide relevant documents of hot deployment?

Question2: 
         Do you have any plan to upgrade the version to solve the hot deployment problem？

> 1. Please set the threshold of slow to at least 2000ms. Because in the traditional ToB systems, latency over 1s is very common.
> 2. This PR should be held until the 8.2.0 release.

done.

@gaoweijie You are asking questions in the wrong way. In the community, we discuss things from the tech perspective, we have no interest in your internal requirements. Those are not our responsibilities.

> Recommend to read `RemoteClientManager#L123`, the duplicated node will be distinct. So, the duplicate instance nodes would not happen in the core.
> NOTE, for many coordinators like ZK, if the OAP reboot, there is a short of time, the register information would be duplicated, as the old temp node has not been removed/expired.

Done, please help to review again, thanks

> @gaoweijie You are asking questions in the wrong way. In the community, we discuss things from the tech perspective, we have no interest in your internal requirements. Those are not our responsibilities.

Yes, you are right.It was my fault to describe the need and background. I just want to learn from you whether it is possible to transform skywalking into a hot deployment system from the tech perspective.

Here's what I've done：
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8943447/96693149-75bb0380-13b9-11eb-9f82-88eadd8cb80f.png)

I  have finished the agent jar by maven.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8943447/96693550-f5e16900-13b9-11eb-8c04-858f089d6a84.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8943447/96693681-1a3d4580-13ba-11eb-8ade-d0fb150c651b.png)

I can really attach the target  pid and jvm information.But I can't get trace info, service info....
There is no error log, and the web requests are all 200 response codes.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8943447/96697836-f2041580-13be-11eb-83ec-b4483fec6388.png)


So I'm confused. What's the problem.

@dmsolr Please do first round review, I will recheck after I am back from the vacation.
Note, if this creates thread pool on the client side, then I am concern.

> MQTT is an OASIS standard, as this, it means there are implementations for supporting this spec. https://mqtt.org/software/
> 
> What is this plugin targeting? Whether all implementations of MQTT would be traced if we have this plugin?
> 
> Also, note, there are MQs like ActiveMQ and RabbitMQ, which we have plugins already. What will happen we have both plugins in the runtime?

1. The goal of the plug-in is to provide the corresponding tracking for the implementers who are using the mqtt protocol. If we have this plug-in, the plug-ins that communicate with the mqtt broker through eclipse PAHO will be tracked. For example, eclipse PAHO client publish message to broker and client consumer message, and then process the user's business logic can be traced, as shown in the following figure:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11907624/96988039-64f3c480-1556-11eb-97fe-17bd49954723.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11907624/96988249-ab492380-1556-11eb-9bab-d371cb33282b.png)

2. If we have other MQ plug-ins and add mqtt plug-ins to run at the same time, there will be no problem. They are independent of each other, as shown in the following figure:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11907624/96987231-4f31cf80-1555-11eb-8dd5-24382566f030.png)

FYI, @wu-sheng @hanahmily What it differs from the previous version is that the different versions of a same service are now collapsed into one service, e.g. in the previous version, reviews-v1, reviews-v2, reviews-v3 are 3 different services, but in this version, they are all collapsed into `reviews`, as a single service, with different version `tag`, (labels: `version=v1`, `version=v2`, etc.), which I think is natural

And now, when testing https://github.com/apache/skywalking/pull/5722 , I've also found that it(Kubernetes Java client) doesn't work well on openjdk:8-jdk (see https://github.com/kubernetes-client/java/issues/1003 although it just happens in Minikube), thus I used openjdk:11-jdk for the tests, I suggest to upgrade the JDK version in the base image ASAP
JDK11 as next TLS, make sense to me. Just feel strange, why JDK version matters

> Yes, the question is about that,but my concern is more about, could rabbitmq and mqtt share one request? Sorry, I am far from understanding what mqtt did.

Rabbitmq itself also supports the mqtt protocol, but it needs to be introduced as a plug-in, which is relatively complex. At present, we have independently deployed the mqtt broker for link tracking. In the IOT business scenario, this deployment method is more common. Of course, if rabbitmq installs the mqtt plug-in, it will not have the problem of tracking links now. Because our mqtt plugin enhances and tracks the mqtt client (eclipse PAHO) of Java, there is no coexistence problem.
